title: Sushi Roll Accompaniments

items.name: Pickled ginger (gari)
items.details: Eaten between bites to cleanse the palate. A standard accompaniment.

items.name: Wasabi
items.details: Spicy green paste, often mixed with soy sauce or dabbed directly on sushi.

items.name: Soy sauce
items.details: For dipping. The most essential accompaniment.

items.name: Daikon radish
items.details: Often shredded or in decorative slices. A traditional Japanese garnish.

items.name: Seaweed salad or cucumber salad
items.details: Light side dishes that complement sushi well.

items.name: Miso soup
items.details: A traditional starter often served alongside sushi.

notes: Americanized add-ons that restaurants often provide include spicy mayo and tempura flakes on the side. The three essentials are pickled ginger, wasabi, and soy sauce.
